country: Democratic Republic of Congo or Central African Republic
creditline: Gift of Marc Felix in honor of Robert Ulrich
description: five-stringed harp, strings missing, with a skin-covered sounding box and a curved grooved neck, topped by a carved head with turban headgear
markings: \'FX96488\', in white paint at back of arm
text: It may resemble a guitar and sound like a lute. But with five strings running perpendicular to its sound box, rather than strung across it, this is a harp—a bow harp, in fact, owing to its shape. A century ago, among the Nzakara people in Central Africa, court poets praised—and sometimes critiqued—the deeds of past and present kings to the accompaniment of a bow harp.
title: Harp
